item.title: Facebook Parenting
item.dc:creator: @Enigma1 Enigma_
item.description:
@Enigma1 wrote:

Notice how most of the people commenting on how he’s a bad parent are either teenagers or otherwise immature individuals.

If you’re going to live under someone’s roof, eat their food, bitch at them to fix your computer, get you a new phone, etc. the very LEAST you can do is help out a bit around the house.

And one more thing:
Why is everyone hung up on the fact that he shot her laptop?
Did he flip his shit, pull out a gun, and start going Rambo? No.

He produced a pistol from his jacket, calmly loaded it, then proceeded to let off eight rounds into the laptop.

He did not exhibit violent behaviour at any point in the video.

Read full topic

i want to find the fb post see if its real or not

Tommy Jordan

item.title: Facebook Parenting
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“m.dog311, post:28, topic:432403”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=535114.msg3914166#msg3914166 date=1329014055]
basically, it’s another kid that thinks all the treats they get are actually rights, and they should be able to do whatever they want and not have to help around the house

not sure i agree with shooting the laptop, as it would have been just as effective to ban her from it/give it away, but i guess it did get the point across
[/quote]
Made a much better video. I mean really, would you rather watch someone unload a .45 on a laptop, or give it away?[/quote]I watched it until the end without knowing he was going to shoot it

[quote=“reyx7, post:26, topic:432403”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=535114.msg3914166#msg3914166 date=1329014055]
not sure i agree with shooting the laptop, as it would have been just as effective to ban her from it/give it away, but i guess it did get the point across
[/quote]

Makes her look like an idiot because all of her friends watched that video.[/quote]She looked like an idiot either way, no matter what he did with it, she still lost it

item.title: Facebook Parenting
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

It’s the best thing that could be done. Unconditional love and such. She will never be able to truly hate him. After all of this, she will realize that she shouldn’t be a bitch. I had 4 days to myself during my summer holidays, all the rest of that time (~8 weeks) was spent working on the farm without a choice. I didn’t complain cause that just makes it less enjoyable. Work hard for a day = ice cream at the end.

Read full topic

item.title: Facebook Parenting
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“tL, post:17, topic:432403”]Or just treat kids properly as if they’re equal and intelligent people and they won’t be cunts. It sounds like it isn’t the first time she hasn’t responded how he would have liked her to, to prior punishments implying that she just isn’t the personality that would accept that. Push on someone like that and they’ll push back harder.

I’m not disagreeing that she was being a bitch, I’m saying that this type of punishment certainly wouldn’t make me respect him anymore. Typical alpha male bullshit that is completely unhelpful in trying to make your kids understand the reasoning as to why you are asking them to do the things they are doing.

But who cares, it was as much about him as it was about his daughter. Look at how awesome he is, he shot the laptop!!![/quote]

Lol, I didn’t see the shooting laptop part. Either way, I’m not necessarily siding so much with him, as I am against the daughter. I disagree with her more than I agree with her father. Although the youtube idea was rather clever and kinda cool, I would agree that it is probably not the right approach in terms of good parenting.

Read full topic

item.title: Facebook Parenting
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Or just treat kids properly as if they’re equal and intelligent people and they won’t be cunts. It sounds like it isn’t the first time she hasn’t responded how he would have liked her to, to prior punishments implying that she just isn’t the personality that would accept that. Push on someone like that and they’ll push back harder.

I’m not disagreeing that she was being a bitch, I’m saying that this type of punishment certainly wouldn’t make me respect him anymore. Typical alpha male bullshit that is completely unhelpful in trying to make your kids understand the reasoning as to why you are asking them to do the things they are doing.

But who cares, it was as much about him as it was about his daughter. Look at how awesome he is, he shot the laptop!!!

Read full topic

item.title: Facebook Parenting
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Phillipé:

old.

Two days old. Your post is pointless.

@OP: Can’t help but completely agree with the guy. If you don’t build a work ethic as a younger child, it’s extremely difficult to do it later on in life. She’s not going to get everything she wants once she moves out (which is especially true based on the attitude of her father). She needs to learn how to be independent and realize that being responsible and mature is more important than not doing whatever she wants when she wants to.

tL:

Yep, he’ll never get respect from her like that.

I beg to differ. She’ll probably hate his guts right now, but what can she do about it? She’s a young and typical adolescent. Her attitude before and after the video is completely predictable. My point is she is bound to get over it, once she realizes how ridiculous she’s being over small things.

Read full topic
